newsitem.title: USA: Barshefsky to unveil telecom deal in U.S. Saturday.
newsitem.headline: Barshefsky to unveil telecom deal in U.S. Saturday.

text.p: U.S. Trade Representative designate Charlene Barshefsky will hold a news conference on Saturday at noon EST (1700 GMT) to announce a global trade deal on telecommunications, her office said on Saturday.

The announcement follows an apparent breakthrough in Geneva just hours before a deadline in negotations that have been underway for months under the sponsorship of the World Trade Organization and were aimed at opening up the $600 billion telecommunications trade to competition.

Earlier in Geneva, U.S. Deputy Trade Representative Jeffrey Lang, who has led Washington's team to the talks, told reporters "the U.S. saw a critical mass now reached," implying the United States was ready to sign a deal after months of playing hard.
But Lang cautioned that other countries would have to maintain their offers as they stood and not introduce any changes before Saturday's deadline of midnight Geneva time (6 p.m. EST/2300 GMT).
European Union Trade Commissioner Sir Leon Brittan also said earlier in Geneva that a deal was essentially cut.
Brittan said the pact would slash telephone costs for ordinary people and businesses around the globe, speed up the digital revolution and boost the two-year-old WTO.
